definition: to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of
to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
to load or unload/to transfer/to assemble and disassemble
to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
(of an actor) to remove makeup and costume/(computing) to uninstall/to unmount
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom)/to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful
to hand over to a successor/to relinquish one's office

sentences.english: As I watched her unload my luggage, I could see the sadness in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她帮我卸着行李，而眼神里却满是伤心和不舍。

sentences.english: The driver turns off the engine and exits the car to retrieve my suitcase from the trunk.
sentences.chinese: 于是，司机停下车，帮我把行囊从后备箱里卸了下来。

sentences.english: So she took the firing pin out of the gun.
sentences.chinese: 所以，她把枪里的撞针卸了出来。

sentences.english: Suppose someone gave you a pen – a sealed, solid-colored pen.
sentences.chinese: 如不美观有人送你一支笔，一支不构怨卸的单色钢笔。

sentences.english: The dockers disburdened the merchandise at the dock.
sentences.chinese: 码头工人把货物卸在码头上。

sentences.english: Don't forget to cut off the electricity supply before discharging the reefer containers.
sentences.chinese: 在卸冷冻集之装箱之前，不要忘了切断电源。

sentences.english: Pressure relief membrane to prevent damage to a confined dust collection device.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止伤害在集尘装置上的卸压膜。

sentences.english: We managed to prise off the lid with a tyre lever.
sentences.chinese: 我们设法用卸外胎用的撬棍撬开了盖子。

sentences.english: We discharged the cargo at London.
Chief, should the damaged container be discharged ashore or laid a side on board for your inspection?
sentences.chinese: 大副，残损集装箱是卸上岸，还是留在船上让你检查？

sentences.english: Paramedics unbolted the toilet seat, and while wheeling a "frightened and humiliated" Dougherty out of the store, he passed out.
sentences.chinese: 为了解救多尔蒂，医务人员把马桶从底座上卸了下来。

sentences.english: We've arranged for one gang to unload the precision apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经派了一个工组来卸精密仪器。

sentences.english: Do you want to discharge oily water from slops tank? Yes, it will be discharged ashore also.
sentences.chinese: 你想卸污油舱的污油水吗？是的，也向岸上排。

sentences.english: The breakout tongs are the active tongs during breakout operations.
sentences.chinese: 在卸开作业的过程中，卸螺纹大钳属于主动型大钳。

sentences.english: We are waiting for the transshipment containers from the feeder barge being loaded to this voyage.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在等卸支线驳的中专集装箱转装到本航次上。

sentences.english: As you can see, the hook is caught and uninstalled.
sentences.chinese: 可以看到，挂勾被捕获并卸除掉了。

definition: (of an actor) to remove makeup and costume/(computing) to uninstall/to unmount
to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
to apply (ointment, powder)/to smear/to paint on
(of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
